body:
### Describe the bug

Anything that needs to decode Python dicts in cygdb fails. The easiest way to notice this is `cy globals` but it shows up in lots of other places as well.

(PS. I looked for related issues but didn't find anything. But 3.11 has been out for a while... Am I really the first person to run into this issue?)

### Code to reproduce the behaviour:

```
Breakpoint 1, 0x00007ffff7813da6 in __pyx_pf_4tbbt_test (__pyx_self=<_cython_3_0_11.cython_function_or_method at remote 0x7ffff7c029b0>) at tbbt.c:2263
2263      __pyx_t_1 = __Pyx_PyObject_Call(__pyx_builtin_print, __pyx_tuple_, NULL); if (unlikely(!__pyx_t_1)) __PYX_ERR(0, 2, __pyx_L1_error)
(gdb) cy globals
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/prakhar/mypyenv/lib/python3.12/site-packages/Cython/Debugger/libpython.py", line 1980, in wrapper
    return function(*args, **kwargs)
           ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "/home/prakhar/mypyenv/lib/python3.12/site-packages/Cython/Debugger/libcython.py", line 108, in wrapper
    function(self, *args, **kwargs)
  File "/home/prakhar/mypyenv/lib/python3.12/site-packages/Cython/Debugger/libcython.py", line 1196, in invoke
    global_python_dict = self.get_cython_globals_dict()
                         ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "/home/prakhar/mypyenv/lib/python3.12/site-packages/Cython/Debugger/libcython.py", line 383, in get_cython_globals_dict
    for k, v in pyobject_dict.iteritems():
  File "/home/prakhar/mypyenv/lib/python3.12/site-packages/Cython/Debugger/libpython.py", line 687, in iteritems
    entries, nentries = self._get_entries(keys)
                        ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  File "/home/prakhar/mypyenv/lib/python3.12/site-packages/Cython/Debugger/libpython.py", line 731, in _get_entries
    dk_size = int(keys['dk_size'])
                  ~~~~^^^^^^^^^^^
gdb.error: There is no member named dk_size.
Python Exception <class 'gdb.error'>: There is no member named dk_size.
Error occurred in Python: There is no member named dk_size.
```

(the breakpoint doesn't matter... Any call that requires translating a Python dict will fail.)

### Expected behaviour

I expect it to not fail :).

### OS

_No response_

### Python version

3.11+

### Cython version

_No response_

### Additional context

I did a little digging on this. The relevant header file is [pycore_dict.h](https://github.com/python/cpython/blob/main/Include/internal/pycore_dict.h).

The field `dk_size` was changed to `dk_log2_size`. This is actually a bit annoying because two other things changed:
* They changed the limits for the size so that they fit into signed ints. The docs in that include file are actually incorrect. The correct docs are in [dictobject.c](https://github.com/python/cpython/blob/main/Objects/dictobject.c#L39-L42).
* There are now two different entry formats (there's a specialized format for string-only dicts).

Luckily both of these changes are relatively simple to handle. The relevant function is [PyDictObjectPtr._get_entries](https://github.com/cython/cython/blob/master/Cython/Debugger/libpython.py#L714). Something like the following works for me:
```
dk_ix_size = 1 << int(keys['dk_log2_index_bytes'])
ent_addr = keys['dk_indices'].address
ent_addr = ent_addr.cast(_type_unsigned_char_ptr()) + dk_ix_size
if int(keys['dk_kind']) == 0:
    ent_ptr_t = gdb.lookup_type('PyDictKeyEntry').pointer()
else:
    ent_ptr_t = gdb.lookup_type('PyDictUnicodeEntry').pointer()
```

(I'd submit a PR but my workplace is paranoid about IP and contributing to open-source projects. I know, it's dumb... Sorry!)
title: [BUG] CygDB doesn't seem to work with Py3.11+
